column1: 130kph, shorter length, he's jumping back and defending awkwardly down to the leg side. Slow bounce off the surface there
edged and just over second slip! It was a good length outswinger, not there to drive, some nip and bounce, he gets a thick edge driving hard and it flies just out of reach of the jumping Root!
good length, nipping back into the pads, it's going well down, it runs behind square for a couple of leg byes
back of a length, 137kph, wide of off, he is back, standing tall and punching wide of mid off
beaten by a 130kph ball, back of a length, nipping across him. He plays well inside the line
137kph/85mph, good length, nipping back down the slope, he leaves on length, and it goes over off stump!
half-volley at 137kph, Finch laces a cover drive! That was a gift. He was hanging back but that was a throw down and he spanked it through cover
good length, off stump line, he defends with the full face pushing back to the bowler
138kph/86mph short outside off, it bounces slowly off the surface, he tries to cut but drags it to mid of
back of a length, nipping back into the inner thigh guard but it was bouncing well over the stumps
139kph, good length, fifth stump line, he pushes forward and defends with pad next to bat
137kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
137kph, good length, across the left hander, it climbs and he leaves well withdrawing the bat
137kph, back of a length on middle, he's jumping back and knocking it down
play and miss nibbling with minimal feet at a good length 134kph ball that nipped away from a length
135kph, good length, wider of off, he is back but watchfully leaving
good length, near off, he was unsure whether to play or leave, he tried to leave but it hit the middle of the bat as he tried to withdraw and it bounces to slip
a drive sliced in the air but well wide of backward point and wide of third man for a couple. he was nowhere near that and just threw his hands at the wider line
fuller outside off, he mistimes a drive, dragging it to mid on
beaten by a cracker! 140kph, back of a length outside off, it nips and climbs away from the bat that was hanging outside off
leading edge off the back of the bat flies safe through gully! Tried to close the face and work to leg and it bounced and came off the leading edge but landed safe short of third man
144kph, back of a length, middle and leg, he's tucked up in defence
141kph, back of a length on leg, hits Warner on the thigh guard as he tries to work behind square
pulled with excellent control behind square! 139kph, short ball, it sits in the surface, he swivels and rolls the wrists from head high, pulling it to the vacant square leg fence. Good shot
138kph, back of a length on off, he's back and punching this to cover-point
Too short and swatted through midwicket! 132kph and chest high outside off, Finch sweats on these, he got it off the toe but pulled powerfully enough through the midwicket gap!
135kph, good length, angled in on off, he's defending with the full face off the back foot to mid on
very full, on off, he digs out a drive to mid off
138kph, fuller on middle, he pushes on the front foot straight of mid on and gets a single
138kph, short into the ribs, he looks to pull but bails out and winces as the ball his the bat hard in defence

dropped at backward point by Vince! Tough chance. Did well to get a hand on it! A sliced drive to backward point, Vince flew like a goalkeeper and just tipped it over the bar with the right hand. Would have been a screamer! Saved two probably
straighter line, he tucks this off the pads behind square
139kph, shorter length, climbing on off, he stays leg side and defends with soft hands
142kph back of a length, on middle, he stays leg side and punches with the bottom hand to cover-point
143kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and across and defending
141kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and across and defending

Huge LBW shout! Not out. England review. He was pinned on the crease by a ball that nipped back. No bat involved. It hit above the knee roll and he was on his toes. Ball tracking says clipping the bails! Not out remains because it's umpire's call!
very full, 139kph, he drives miscuing, dragging it wide of mid on
lofted over mid off! 138kph, full and Warner just checks a drive through the line lofting it over mid off! Good shot. Brave shot. England won't mind it
Appeal for caught behind! Not out. No review. Back of a length, nipping through the gate, it clipped the back thigh and went through to the keeper. Great decision
fuller outside off, he pushes from the crease to the gap at cover
he walks down early, gets a full ball and drives handsomely straight to mid on
141kph, back of a length on middle, he defends from the crease
146kph, swinging down leg, hits him the pad but it was well outside leg and the appeal is aborted
shorter length, he's back and defending into the off side
145kph, half volley on leg, he clips this neatly into the gap through midwicket and they pick three with nice timing
full outside off, he plays a lovely drive with a flowing bat but straight to mid off
beaten on the inside edge! Cut him in half, nipping down the slope from back of a length, it went through the gate but missed the edge
135kph, short of a length, nipping across and beating the edge as he tries to defend
135kph, length ball, he skips down but has to defend on the move, punching it to point
back of length outside off and he leaves
back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot and it comes off thick inside edge to square leg
this seams miles up the hill from back of a length, excellent leave to watch it go over the stumps
137kph, fuller on off, hint of shape away, he gets a slight leading edge but adjusts leaving the face open to push back to the bowler
143kph, short into the ribs, he pulls this well wide of fine leg and Rashid runs around to make a diving stop
cracked past point! Short and wide, he was back in a flash and crunching this powerfully through point down the hill!
142kph, shorter length on leg, he defends off a thick inside edge and it runs through forward square
139kph, short of a length, nipping into the thigh guard and it runs to point
141kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and working to midwicket
141kph, good length on off, nipping away he's squared up walking into a defensive push but it rolls through gully to third man
Finch on the walk, Woakes drags his length back outside off at 135kph, and he defends to cover
good length, nipping back and hitting the pad but it's well outside the line
wide of the crease, good length, 134kph, angled in, he's forward to defend solidly
135kph, fuller outside off, he's forward to drive but mistimes it dragging it wide of mid on
136kph, back of a length outside off, he punches firmly off the back foot to point
137kph, fuller on middle and off, he defends from the crease towards mid on
140kph, shorter length into the hip joint and Finch is down. That would have hurt. It missed the thigh guard
140kph, into the hip again and he glance fine for four! Too straight and fine leg is wide. The pace took it to the boundary
fuller, 146kph outside off, he drives sweetly to mid off
148kph, angling back in and he defends off the inside edge onto pad
147kph, short into the thigh pad and it rolls forward of square
huge swing and miss on the drive. This was angled well wide of off, tempting the drive, he swung hard but was beaten by the angle
134kph, full outside off, he drives and drags it straight of mid on! He didn't intend to drag it there but the timing was good enough for it to race down the ground
he's on the walk and it's fired way down the leg side
134kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot pushing firmly to mid off
134kph, good length on off, he defends with the full face half forward
cut in half by one that seams back! It was short, he shaped to cut but it nipped back sharply past the inside edge and through to Buttler
driven powerfully in the air straight of mid off! Slightly over-pitched, not a half volley though, he gambled and drove through the line in the air but nailed it!
beaten driving outside off! Stood the seam up, tempted the drive, he played but it nipped away late and beat the bat
pulled over mid on! 144kph, slightly short but in the pulling arc outside off, he was sitting back and waiting and he clubbed it flat over mid on! Nowhere near the fielder
over-pitched and he clips this beautifully with control through the vacant midwicket and they run three. Didn't try to over hit it.
143kph, short and he pulls wide of mid on! He didn't flush this, but the placement was good and it raced over the outfield and away to the rope!
146kph, back of a length on off, he's pushing forward and defending
142kph, short down leg, he tried to glance but misses and it's called wide
148kph, full angled into middle, he clips this straight to the man in close at midwicket
147kph, good length, angled in, he defends on the front foot towards mid on
134kph short outside off, he punches off the back foot to deep cover-point
139kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and working this to mid on
139kph, shorter length on off, he's back and working this to the gap at midwicket
140kph, back of a length outside off, he cuts firmly but with control to deep point
138kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending with the full face
139kph, back of a length, he pushes off the back foot to the gap at cover
pulled behind square to the short boundary! Too short, he was sitting back waiting and he just pulls it easily behind square well wide of long leg
149kph, over-pitched, he hammers a drive back the bowler who gets hit on the leg as he knocks it down
drives in the air but just short of mid off! Lucky he miscued that it landed just short of Rashid on the circle
147kph, yorker speared into middle and leg, he drops the bat down and digs it out well
smashing cover drive! 149kph half volley outside off, like a throw down, he climbed into, opened the chest and smacked it past cover!
full again, 151kph, angled into leg, he drives neatly to mid on
round the wicket, lots of air, Warner strides forward with confidence and slaps a drive to the cover sweeper
back of a length, a slip in place, Warner leans back and cracks to short cover
good areas from Moeen, dipping on middle and off and defended with head over the ball
advancing to the pitch of the ball, clipped to short midwicket, and a loose throw from Morgan gives away overthrows! Careless, that skidded into Buttler's pads and away to fine leg
on the back foot, punched with a straight bat to mid-on
shuffling at the crease, sliding onto the back foot, cracked out to deep point
inside-out lofted drive, over mid-off!
on the pads, tucked to the leg side
dragged down, that's a poor ball! Smashed with glees through square leg where Bairstow's despairing dive can't cut it off
firmly forward, bat and pad tight in defence
pounded through the covers, and up comes the hundred! This is such an ominously strong start from Australia
leaning forward to dot up the over. What a commanding performance he's putting in again
smashed off a full length! England's fielders get in a tangle as they cut off the ball inside the longest boundary at cow corner, and up comes the skipper's fifty
flicked off the toes to the leg side
cracked through point and gathered in the deep. Easy pickings now ...
into line and clipped into space on the leg side
solid in defence once more as Moeen ploughs away from round the wicket
deep into the crease, pushing from the back foot, picked up in the covers as they pick off the single
tucked into the gap and Warner too has his fifty! Ticking along at just about a run a ball, with the promise of fireworks to come... superb
stretching forward and nudged to the leg side
full face, defending back up the line of the the ball and gathered by the bowler
a fraction shorter, firmly cracked out to point off the back foot
tossed up on a middle and leg line, and tapped back to the bowler. No spin for Rashid, it's all very flat for England ...
leg-stump line, tucked behind square. Tidy but unthreatening from Rashid
a bit of spin this time for Moeen as Finch hits with the angle off the back foot, straight to mid-on
tighter line, solid defence, back to the bowler
anchored on the back foot, solid in defence
chopped into the covers where Archer sprawls but can't quite intercept cleanly
round the wicket, chopped to backward point ... 'wait on, not now...' is the call for the second
leaning out of the crease, dabbed to cover. England content to tick off some tidy overs while they wait for a bit of inspiration ...
stretching forward in defence
reverse sweep, can't nail it this time as backward point gathers
on the legs, nudged to midwicket and up comes Warner's 500th run of the tournament. Stunning
tossed above the eyeline, outside off, Finch's eyes light up but he can't connect properly with a wild mow
crashed to the off side, cover swoops as Warner dances at the crease once more
skids a touch lower on a wider line, a splatted cut to backward point. Solid once more
punched calmly into the gap in the covers
here comes Finch! Right in his arc, full length, outside off, launched majestically over the leg side!
back of a length, tucked off the back foot to cover

Warner's gone! This is a massive breakthrough for England, a bit of extra kick outside off, and Root at backward point snaffles a llimp uppish punch off the back foot. Suckered off the pitch, and startled mid-stroke, but that's been an brilliant start for Australia
eased down to long off to get off the mark
nurdled to mid-on to keep the strike.
tossed up and blocked on the crease
leg-sided, a bit of a poor ball, but gets away with it as Finch scuffs his urgent pull to the man on the 45
leg-break to the leftie, defended on the back foot
flicked off the back foot back to the bowler
down on one knee for the sweep, and Woakes scuttles round to gather
angles the bat outside off as Rashid probes the outside edge, tapped to short third man
angled defence into the off side
sliding onto the back foot, meeting a length-ball offbreak with a clip off the pads
fully forward once more
a drag-down from Moeen as he ramps up the pace, a flat-batted pull round the corner, contact at ankle height, but Root does well to intercept behind square
speared in on the leg stump, defended
pounded majestically over long-on! Woakes was back on the rope but that was belligerently nailed, leaning back, short arms, full power, pounded out of the arc and over the rope!
a bit of spin this time as Khawaja defends watchfully
advancing to the pitch, a scuffed drive back up the track
a pre-meditated scoop-sweep, planting the foot outside off stump and lofting over the shoulder to backward square
fully forward, closed face of the bat, nudged to the leg side
sliding on on a middle-stump line, slashed back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up outside off, met on the full with a toe-ended drive to deep cover. There's a modicum of control in the innings at the moment, but England are still staring down a massive chase
pushed languidly into the covers
fast and flat, blocked
outside off, on the back foot, chopped to point where Archer fumbles again. Odd errors
full length, defended
clipped off the pads to the leg side
a thick edge, and that's fizzed to the third man rope. No slip, so perfectly safe... the runs keep rattling up
missed stumping! A perfect googly, tweaks past the edge as the back foot slides out of the crease, and Buttler's iron gloves strike!
reverse sweep, nailed! Take that... insult to injury for England now ...
flicked off the toes to long-on... long faces in the England field now
driven from a very full length, down to long on
tucked back to the bowler
big-spinning googly from outside leg, pulled to backward square. Gosh. A big moment in that over
back of a length, tight line outside off, defended into the off side
too short from Stokes, but Khawaja can't time his pull from outside off, mid-on gathers as they pinch the single
clipped off the legs, finds the gap behind square
fenced on the up to point, 'arghh, c'mon!' says Finch as he misses out with a loose punch
beauty! Good full length, and massive jag off the seam as Finch is turned inside out. Comprehensively beaten
rolls the fingers on a fuller length, punched solidly to cover... A better over for England's prospects
reverse sweep, doesn't connect this time
tight leg-stump line, clipped to square leg
thumps the pad on a leg-stump line as Finch wafts across the line
back of a length, tapped down the pitch on the back foot to long-on
advancing out of the crease, flicked urgently off the pads, but Stokes at midwicket makes good scrambling ground
a swishy pull, down the leg side, in the air for a while but bobbling safely to fine leg
banged in short, firmly pulled, just short of Moeen at short midwicket!
smashed with intent towards the Mound Stand rope and that's a brilliant sprawling dive from Archer! Intercepting a violent drive
on the pads, whisked round the corner to backward square
tapped to backward point, off the back foot, more easy strike rotation
well bowled, another cutter, taking pace off the ball on a full length, and Finch adjusts well at the last split-second
bouncer! Good wheels as Finch swings into a pull but the ball is already long gone. Another decent over, but there's no real danger of a breakthrough
more cunning angles from Khawaja, walking across his stumps to dab behind square with a measured sweep
a more forceful sweep to deep backward square. Good connection but straight to the man
easing forward, pushed to mid-off
fenced off the back foot into the covers, solid connection
lots more air, and that's brilliantly timed and placed! Finch waited, and waited, and waited, then laced his drive clean through the infield. Perfection. He's into the nineties
solid in defence to seal another domineering over. Rashid has been tidy but lacked threat today
back of a length, outside off, chopped down into the crease as Khawaja looks to run the single through third man

bowled him! 90mph from Stokes, right into the blockhole, and Khawaja was simply beaten for pace as this shaped back in as he wafted rather loosely across the line. A vital incision to end a burgeoning stand
outside off, back of a length, punched to point and gathered with a loud 'no!'
a flashing drive into the off side, urgent bat on ball already from Smith
wider on the crease, banging in the short ball, Finch rolls his wrists on a pull to backward square
flinched to the leg side, a fine over from Stokes. A glimmer from England in a strangely subdued display
open-faced poke to backward point
outside off, beats the edge! Only 83mph, but that nipped off the seam, extra bounce taking it past a tentative nervous-nineties poke
into the toes, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, an under-cooked back-foot punch, down into the crease
rolls the fingers once more, a length ball outside off, at 74mph... well watched as Finch opens the face for a glide to gully
too short and wide, but the cover sweeper is on hand to cut the damage to a single. Finch keeps the strike
outside off, riding the bounce with a punch to cover
momentary confusion! Both batsmen recover after a brief calling mix-up
squared up on the leg side, clipped to mid-on
swinging into a pull, not properly connected this time
up on the toes, defended to the off side
square-driven out to the point sweeper
Smith nearly run out backing up too far! Driven to mid on, Finch called no, Smith sent back, he had to dive to get back to beat the throw
whipped to fine leg and a misfield allows him to back for two! A brilliant century from the skipper!

caught at fine leg! What has he done? A century and out. A high short ball, he was sucked into hooking, it was high and outside his eyeline, he gets a top edge that flies to fine leg and Woakes, after misfielding to concede his hundred, hangs on to the catch. Big blow landed by England
tickled fine for four! He shuffled across outside off, got a shorter length and tickled it fine
118kph slower ball on off, he's back and across, working this behind square for a single
143kph brute first up. He fends it away off the splice and it lands well short of backward point
139kph back of a length outside off, he pushes off the back foot to backward point
141kph, angled into leg, he glances this to fine leg from the stumps
144kph full outside off, he drives firmly to mid off
145kph, short ball, chest high, he pulls with control through square leg to the sweeper
over-pitched and driven beautifully straight of mid on! 135kph, cutter but it was a half volley and he crunched it straight down the ground
opens the face and runs fine of third man! Short outside off, he just opened the blade, used the pace and ran it fine of third man
142kph back of a length on off, he is back and across and defending
launched over wide long on! Goodness what a shot! Full in the slot, he just teed off, smoking this 97m over wide long on and into the crowd!
<strong>heaved over midwicket one bounce four!</strong Length ball in the slot again, he set himself and mowed it over midwicket and there is no one out there!
150kph, fuller outside off, he drives but miscues this off the inside half of the bat through midwicket
142kph bumper outside off, he drops the knees and sways underneath it
119kph slower ball, leg cutter, shorter length, he's back and working this behind square
150kph/93mph good length outside off, he's back and across, opening the face and running to third man
caught behind! 143kph short ball lifting outside off, Maxwell was caught in two minds as to what to do, he tried to run it to third man, got a thin edge through to Buttler who took a simple catch
148kph, back of a length wide of off, he raises the bat and allows it to pass
147kph/91mph, good length outside off, he defends on the front foot with an open face, running it to backward point
beaten by a beauty! 152kph, good length ball that straightens outside off and beats the edge as he defends!
147kph, short ball, lifting outside off, he drops the hands and sways under it
tossed up leg break, he drives easily to long on
leg break on off, he pushes forward and defends
80kph slow leg break outside off, he defends on the front foot
78kph leg break on off, he pushes gently off the front foot to cover
high loopy 63kph leg break outside off, he waits and waits and waits and drives firmly to long off
wrong un, Smith doesn't pick it until late and is taken on the pad
shorter length outside off, he's back and defending to cover point
crunched on the up past cover! Wasn't that full but there was width and he threw his hands through it and place it straight of the sweeper at deep cover-point. Excellent timing
149kph, shorter length outside off, he opens the face and slices this to third man
145kph, length on middle, he steps across his stumps and whips this behind square to the sweeper
leading edge flying through gully! He was squared up by a ball angled in and straightening, it flew off the edge but there is no gully and it goes to third man
146kph, bouncer, outside off, he shapes to pull but bails up, extravagantly withdrawing the bat underneath
79kph tossed up wrong un, he mistimes a drive, dragging it to midwicket
flatter leg break, 79kph, on middle, he drives but can't beat Rashid who dives to knock it down
shorter length, he's back and punching down to straight long on
drag down and hammered over midwicket! Shocking delivery. Half tracker and he could hit this anywhere, he just smacked it into the gap at midwicket

horror mix up and Stoinis is run out as they end up at the same end! Smith drives past cover wide of long off, Stoinis touches for one and sprint back for two and Smith doesn't run! Stoinis would have beaten the throw running to the non-striker's but he keeps running to the rooms. Rashid gathers and lobs it Buttler!
tossed up and he drives to cover
144kph, angled down the leg side and called wide
good length, 134kph, he whips this from off stump through midwicket
lifting short ball outside off, he withdraws the bat and leaves this
142kph, into the ribs, he rises with the bounce and knocks it down into the leg side for a single
148kph, back of a length outside off, it nips away and beats the bat as he tries to drive off the back foot through point
147kph bouncer, he ducks under it late. Proper heat this
angled into the hip, he works this neatly wide of long leg and they get a couple
131kph, back of a length on off, he defends with soft hands into the off side for a single
131kph, back of a length outside off, he is back and across and working this to midwicket
132kph, back of a length on off, he's squared up defending but gets it through cover-point
136kph, full outside off, he drives flowingly wide of mid off but can't beat the man on the circle
slower ball cutter, 115kph, he defends with soft hands short of cover and they pinch one
smoked through midwicket! Superb pull shot. Fractionally short and he was so quick to seize the length, smacking this to the gap at deep midwicket and beat the sweeper
150kph, half volley outside off, he clears the front leg and hits it straight to cover
123kph, slower ball, he stays leg side and punches this through point
127kph, shorter slower ball, he's back and across and tucking this through square leg
142kph, short into the ribs, he swivels on the pull but is hurried, he gets it fine with no timing
142kph, short outside off, he's back and running this down to third man
149kph, fuller outside off, he drives slowly to long off and Smith takes on the throw running to the non-striker's but he gets there easily
135kph, back of a length wide of off, he carves this off the back foot straight to backward point
113kph, slower ball, off cutter, he tried to whip this behind square but is taken on the thigh and they get a leg bye
114kph, length slower ball, he stays leg side and punches this through cover-point

holes out to long on! Archer takes the catch running in! It was full outside off, he tried to whip this up and over the man in the circle at midwicket, but completely miscued skying towards long on, Archer had to run in some way but he did well to get there and hold on coming forward
134kph, full angled across him, he slices a drive wide of third man and he gets two
115kph slower ball on the hip, he pulls this down to fine leg
smoked through point! 130kph slower ball, he cleared the front leg and carved it past point and placed it brilliantly
short and wide, 142kph, he hammers a cut but Vince makes the stop at backward point
148kph, low full toss, he square drives to deep cover-point
149kph, short lifter outside off, he tries to run to third man but he's beaten by the pace and bounce
beaten again. This is a beauty. Length, angled in, seaming away, zipping past the edge
short into the ribs, 88mph, he pulls awkwardly down to fine leg
edged and taken by Buttler! Good delivery. Good length outside off, seam was wobbling, he drives without much footwork, it takes the edge and Buttler dives low to his right to hang on
112kph, short slower ball, he rides the bounce and runs this to third man
nearly a run out! Short into the body, he tried to pull, it comes off the body, and rolls down the pitch, Starc runs through and barely beats the throw from Woakes but it didn't hit
huge swing and miss at a short ball angled across
short slower ball into the ribs, 115kph, he tucks this behind square
short slower ball, he pulls behind square to the gap but Bairstow swoops to prevent two
full toss wide outside the guideline and called
magnificently timed inside out through cover! A slower ball but a half volley, Carey waits, clearing the front leg and driving with supreme timing through cover
142kph, full on middle, he stays leg side but mistimes a drive dragging it to mid on
141kph, bouncer, angled in, he ducks under it early
145kph, yorker, he digs this out to long off, they want two but it's not on
147kph, wide yorker, he miscues a square drive backing away, getting it into the off side
ramped to fine third man! Lovely shot. He backed away to the short ball, angled the bat and just upper cut it fine, using the pace and third man has no chance
140kph, full on leg, he misses out, getting an inside edge onto pad and it goes back to the bowler
short slower ball, outside off, he bunts it to the gap at cover-point
121kph, short slower ball loops over the head of Carey, tight but not called wide. That was a fair call
clears the front leg and lifts this up and over cover! Got the length he wanted and just lifted it over the man in the circle
clears the front leg, and tries to heave it, he miscues through midwicket and they sprint back for a tight two
hammered forward of cover-point! He got a slower ball wide of off, and he slashed it hard forward of the man on the rope and beat the fielder!
left-arm over the wicket with a tight leg-stump line to the right-hander, solid in defence, up to mid-on

massive inswinger and Vince has been castled! Shades of Starc to Brendon McCullum in the World Cup final 2015, looking to drive but nowhere near the ball, and huge jubilation for the Aussies! Wow, what a start! If England thought they could shake off their nerves with belligerence, they've got another thing coming!
outside off, and this one nips off the seam away towards the cordon
up on the toes, punched with stiff forearms into the covers
ploughing a tight line across the right-hander, nip away from the bat once more as Root leaves alone
short, wide, chancy! It was confident enough in the end, but a touch tentative on the cut as Root placed the ball past a leaping Maxwell at backward point. England are up and running ...
jeepers, that's a good leave! Outside off, nipping back in, skims past the off stump with good carry! Starc hitting the seam from the get-go
wider line, 147kph, which isn't too shabby, nips away as Bairstow leaves alone
wristy from Bairstow... not quite to the pitch, not quite timed either, but plinked through the gap in the covers with an open face and lots of momentum
fuller length outside off, Bairstow brings out the kitchen sink and scuffs a wild drive on the bounce to third man
whoops, can't bowl there to Root! Swinging on a leg-stump line, ever further past the stumps, Root places bat on ball and tickles it fine through the finest of fine legs
a calm leave on a fuller length outside off. It's been a bit skittish from England so far, but no further chances...
pops from just back of a length, angled across Bairstow who is anchored on the back foot, wary of the inswinger. Beaten outside off
solid, full face, defending on off stump with a loud 'no!'
attempted pull, whistles into the midriff
perfect timing, meeting the inswing with a clip off the pads. Full face on contact, clean through long-on
solidly forward, defending on off stump
tight into the pads, Bairstow loses one hand on the bat as he attempts to deflect off the hip
driven, loosely, and passes the inside edge! Tentative and extravagant from Root, very hard hands, and too late on the stroke too
stiff-limbed once more, as Root fences this off the front foot into the covers

there's the inswinger again! Pace, length, inswing, it's a stunning triple whammy, and though Root thinks of the review, he knows it is utterly plumb! He was simply late on the stroke once again, even though his entire set-up had been primed for it. These are very, very dangerous signs for the world No.1s!
banged into the hip, Morgan shuffles across his crease
loose from Morgan! Staying very leg-sided in order to free up the drive, but there was big late outswing to the left-hander, and it zipped past the edge!
cramped on the pads, speared across the left-hander. A wicket maiden!
outside off, through to the keeper once again
tentative from Bairstow! Another poke forward on off stump, paralysed by fear of the inswinger, and nearly allows this to wriggle down into his crease
there is the inswinger, but it's on the pads. Can't clip it fine
fired past the leg stump
width, and an attempted slash through the off-side, but can't connect properly
fierce from Morgan! Skipping to the pitch like a frisky spring lamb, and plundered through long-off! Intent from the skipper! Wolf in lamb's clothing
anchored to the crease this time as Behrendorff finds extra nip outside off, and leaves it alone
back of a length, tight line, poked into the leg side with a closed face
Bairstow at his best! Seizing on the half-volley outside off stump, and simply extends his arms through the line of the ball, from a solid base. No stopping that!
back of a length, tighter line, that's excellently left
inswing once more, but Bairstow is alive to it, waiting deep in his crease and nudging to the leg side

banged in short, Morgan climbs into the pull but that's a top-edge! Cummins steadies himself inside the fine-leg rope, and this innings is in tatters now! The surprise bouncer reaps its rewards. England's fabled depth is going to be tested once again!
another left-hander meets the outswinger with a tentative push. Gosh, this is getting lively
driven off an inside edge, back down the pitch
driven, without conviction, meeting the full length, just a touch of inswing taking the ball away from the meat of the bat
pressed with caution into the off side, meeting one that shapes back into the right-hander with hard hands
on the back foot, defended back down the track to the bowler

skims over mid-off! Aaron Finch on a stepladder would have swallowed that! Bairstow planted the front foot, walloped through the line, really high on the bat and crowbarred to the rope with a huge slice of fortune!
more solid in defence now... another over survived by the skin of England's teeth
outside off, through to the keeper
back of a length, leg-sided, fended to the on-side off the back foot
on the back foot, tapped to the off side, watchful in defence
outside off and through to the keeper
Stokes advances and is beaten outside off! Half an appeal from Carey as the ball skims through
a skimmer outside off, Stokes rocks back to pull but can't connect. Cummins opens his account with a maiden to crank up the pressure ever more
fenced off the back foot, into the leg side
a flat-footed mow! Keeps low to beat the waft, but that was loose either way
pounded off the back foot! Bairstow's cover driving, off front foot and back, can be sublime. Back of a length this time, and piercing the covers like a high-pitched screech
pulled, firmly, off the back foot. Gathered at square leg
back of a length, outside off, solidly blocked into the off side
nip off the seam on off stump, Stokes rides the awkward bounce as he removes his bottom hand in surprise
squares up on the back foot, presenting a full face of the bat to see off the off-stump lifter
nurdled off the legs, dead-batted to short midwicket
rooted on the back foot, full face of the bat in defence once again
supreme clip off the legs! This is becoming a fine innings from Bairstow, capitalising once again on a slightly awry line, and that races down the slope to the Tavern stand
fenced to midwicket once again but without the timing
firm in defence, that's the Powerplay done and dusted. Australia's 'phase', you have to say!
tight line, back of a length, jabbed down into the pitch as Stokes is briefly caught in two minds
more surprise for Stokes as this one pops! Plays it well enough in the end, but there's nip off this deck for the tall seamers
emphatic from Stokes! He's off the mark with a Morgan-esque shimmy and slam, freeing the arms for a wild slap through the covers. Three steps down the pitch
Behrendorff gets straight back onto that awkward popping length. Stokes defends with the inside half of his bat, on the back foot
another advance to the pitch, Behrendorff hauls his length back by a yard and forces a defensive block into the covers
deep in the crease this time from Stokes, no attempt to disrupt the length this time, so Behrendorff drops it on a sixpence and lets the pitch do the rest. Blocked. This is a thrilling mini-duel
there's one of those singles, chiselled off the pads, behind square
solidly forward in defence
ooh, loose .... back of a length, an attempted chop through point but this hops over the swishing blade
cut, firmly, to Khawaja at deep backward point. Good running brings them back for two
outside off, no stroke this time
banged in short, but that's a confident controlled pull from Stokes, rolling the wrists on impact and steering it down to deep backward square
back of a length, turning gently away, cut off the back foot to deep cover

extra bounce and Stokes nearly chops to point! Identical to the Warner dismissal in the first innings, more pop and grip outside off, and surprising the left-hander on the cut. But this one squirts to no-man's land
on the back foot, clipping with the spin to long-on
reverse sweep, well intercepted by Smith, still crouching at slip
fenced to the off side
on the pads, nurdled with the spin to square leg
squared up and a leading edge! Pops into the covers, and inches short of the sprawling Warner... Zoinks!
on the legs, tucked to midwicket, looking for two but it's not on this time
solid in defence, on the back foot
good leave outside off, bending back into the right-hander but on a wide enough line to ignore

Bairstow holes out to deep midwicket! That's a flaccid finish to a fighting knock, climbing into the pull but beaten once again by the extra bounce from the lanky Behrendorff! Cummins is lurking back on the rope and England are ever deeper in the soup!
131kph, short of a length across him, he rises and gets on top of the bounce running it to third man
tossed up on off, he steps forward and defends
looped up outside off, a bit of turn, he tries to drive through the off side but drags it to long on
good length on off, he steps forward and defends
flatter on off, he's back and defending to point
slid through on leg, he's back and working this off his pads to deep forward square
flatter and wider of off, he's back and forcing to deep cover-point
over-pitched and driven neatly through cover! Gentle loosener and he leaned forward and crunched it
sliced in the air but safe through the vacant gully to third man
141kph, back of a length, top of off, he defends from the crease to mid on
fuller on off, he drives on the up back to the bowler
144kph, short into the ribs, he pulls but is hurried, getting it down to fine leg
low full toss edged along the ground wide of slip and Behrendorff makes a good sliding save on the rope to save two
drifting down leg, he tickles this fine with the angle and Buttler runs brilliantly to get three
beaten on the inside edge! This gripped and bounced through the gate and over the stumps and Carey couldn't glove it cleanly. They get a bye
flatter and it slides on low, he's back and jamming the bat down
good length, close to off, he gives room and hammers a cut hard forward of the sweeper at deep point for two
very full on off, he's back and defending from deep in the crease
tossed up outside off, he drives on the front foot to long off
short on the hip, he flicks this high in the air and wide of fine leg, Behrendorff gets there on the bounce and they get two
144kph, angled into leg stump, he clips this off the pads through square leg tot he sweeper
145kph, short under the arm pit, he pulls awkwardly, gloving it along the ground through square leg
134kph, angled into leg stump, he tucks this behind square into the gap and Stokes calls for two and gets it easily
151kph, full and tailing into off, he plays a lovely on drive but straight to Finch at mid on
143kph, short into the ribs, he pulls around the corner powerfully but straight to long leg
he charges a 136kph length ball and chops it to cover
138kph, back of a length angled into off, he defends from the crease into the off side
137kph, angled into middle and leg, he clips this neatly straight to midwicket
he charges and hits a pull shot like a bullet through midwicket! On the advance he got a short ball and it was in his arc! He clubbed it
back of a length outside off, he defends to backward point
143kph, angled into middle, full length, he clips this with the angle to mid on but can't beat the man
127kph, good length on off, he's back and working this through forward square
beats the edge with some extra bounce outside off. It was only 123kph but it climbed as he tried to run it to third man
charges and lofts it over mid on! Again he skips down, he got a length ball in the arc and just lifted it over mid on and it nearly went all the way
126kph, angled into leg stump, he clips this through forward square to the sweeper
he steps down the wicket, Stoinis delivers a slower ball yorker, it's defended
128kph, full and angled into leg stump, he clips this neatly behind square for a couple
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he pushes off the back foot to cover
140kph, good length angled into off, he punches from the back foot with the angle to midwicket
139kph, back of a length on off, he's defending from the crease into the leg side
121kph, slower ball on off, he defends with soft hands, steering to the gap at cover-point
short, 146kph, down leg, he gets inside the line and pulls it along the ground to fine leg
140kph, back of a length outside off, he tries to cut but mistimes it to backward point
122kph, good length outswinger, he defends with firm hands to cover

he skipped down to a 126kph cutter and was taken on the pad it rolls to midwicket. Stoinis appeal for LBW. It's not out. But after some lengthy conversation Finch reviews!. He was miles down the track and outside the line. Impact was well outside the line. Terrible review from Australia

Smith misses a run out chance! Buttler was cooked! It was full, Stokes got if off the pad, it rolls towards midwicket, Buttler is slow to respond to the call, Smith pounced moving forward and underarmed flicked as Buttler dived, Smith missed but Buttler was short!
full on off, he on drives down to long on
good length on off, he defends on from the crease
130kph shin high full toss but he just pushes it gently to long on
pushed through on off, he defends from the crease
cracking sweep shot behind square! It was a decent ball on off, but he got down early and smashed this flat and hard behind square and the sweeper stood no chance
back of a length on off, he defends to cover
tossed higher on off, he's forward and defending
slightly shorter, he gives room to cut firmly to deep cover-point
attempted paddle sweep from outside off, but he misses. Carey didn't glove it cleanly but he blocked it well enough
he charges and backs away to a 128kph length cutter, he adjusts and prods it to backward point
slower ball on leg, he's back and across and working this to midwicket
129kph, full on leg stump, he clips this neatly behind square to the sweeper
132kph, shorter length, he tries to pull but it skids a touch and takes him on the thigh guard and bounces away
126kph, short ball, he swivels and controls a pull shot forward of square to the sweeper
126kph, yorker outside off, Buttler jams it off the toe of the bat, and is rolls behind to the keeper
leading edge for four straight of mid on! Finch was beaten for pace at mid on! He misread how that bounced off the turf
shorter length, he's back and cracking this straight to point
tossed up outside off, he pushes towards long off but Lyon dives to his right and saves it
flatter, darted into off, he defends back to the bowler
beaten trying to cut a ball too close to off! That was not far away. He was beaten for bounce
drifting into off, he defends towards midwicket
126kph, back of a length on off, he's back trying to force through the off side but gets it off the inside half of the bat behind square
full on leg stump, he clips this behind square to bring up a half-century. He's played well in this rebuild
131kph, good length outside off, he drives on the up through cover-point to the sweeper
good length slower ball, 117kph, on leg, he's taken on the thigh guard
127kph short ball, he pulls with control through square leg to the sweeper
over-pitched and whacked straight of mid on! Just a dismissive swat with the bottom hand to thump this along the ground straight of mid on and he didn't bother running
shorter length, he's back and punching down to long off
Buttler skips down early and pads this ball away as Lyon had dragged the length back
short and he gives room to cut hard behind point but Cummins makes a great diving save on the rope to save two
attempted sweep, he paddles it onto his foot trying to get it fine
shorter length on leg, he whips this away through square midwicket to the sweeper
arm ball sliding into off, he's back and working this to cover-point, they take a tight one but Buttler beats the throw well enough
114kph, slower ball dragged down the leg side
130kph, he charges and backs away, cutting a length ball through point

caught at deep square! What a catch from Khawaja on the rope! Buttler can't believe it! He got a length ball on the hip and flicked it powerfully and flat behind square, Khawaja tight-roped the boundary at full pace, took the catch with two hands running to his right and kept his balance while never stepping on the rope!
130kph, yorker on middle, he digs this out the bowler
slower ball, on off, he pushes on the front foot back to the bowler
chest high short ball, 126kph, he swivels and pulls through forward square
127kph, back of a length outside off, he defends from the crease
drifting into leg, he drives to long on
shorter length off break, he's back and pulling this to midwicket
drifting wide of off, no spin, he drives and misses
tossed up outside off, he gets a thick inside edge onto pad
flighted outside off, he sits back and cuts hard to deep point
drifting into leg stump, he clips this with the angle through square leg
114kph, length slower ball, he charges and drives on the up but straight to cover
109kph. slower ball, off spinner, he waits and drives straight back to the bowler
short slower ball, he waits and just runs this to short third man

Smith misses another run out! Woakes was also done and dusted if he hit! Stokes just poked it to him at midwicket and ran, Smith had a lot of time to gather and size them up but he missed. Woakes was well short
yorker length outside off, he jams the bat down and digs it out
116kph, slower ball, he pushes on the front foot to mid on
drag down and hoicked high over square leg! Bad ball and he hammered this pull shot way over the fence
darted into off, he defends from the crease
swept flat for six forward of square! He got down on one knee, swept from off stump but it's the short boundary and he got enough of it to carry all the way
flatter on middle, he defends from the crease
round arm, flatter on middle, he defends on the front foot
darted into off, he pushes off the front foot to point
full on leg stump, 119kph, he clips to midwicket
113kph, slower ball, it grips, he gets an inside edge onto the back thigh and it rolls behind, they pinch a tight one
short slower ball, 118kph, he swivels and pulls to fine leg
127kph, full on off, he whips this through midwicket to the sweeper
he skips down to a good length ball and clips this powerfully to long on
112kph, slower ball on off, he pushes off the front foot to cover
shorter length, he's back and punching this to cover-point
attempted slog sweep but he's beaten and he cops it on the body
shorter length, he's back and hammering it to cover and Smith makes a superb diving save!
pushed through of off, he works this wide of mid on
shorter length, he punches off the back foot to cover and the sub fielder Coulter-Nile misfields to allow a single
reverse sweep to fine third man but he doesn't beat the diving Warner
138kph, good length angled into off, he defends from the crease
over-pitched and he clips this beautifully wide of mid on! Lovely timing and placement to find the gap
good length wide of off, he opens the face and runs it to third man
137kph, back of a length on off, he stands tall and defends
138kph, good length, he tries to drive expansively but drags it to mid on
137kph short ball, he pulls and gets it in the gap between midwicket and mid on!
a touch of swing from the spinner, hooping into a leg-side clip for the single
propping half forward, nudging to the leg side and declining the single with his calf still giving him gyp
on the legs, nudged round the corner, popped a touch on the right-hander
more bounce from a tight line, back of a length, Stokes stays on top of a measured cut into the covers
compact punch from deep in the crease, meeting the quicker ball with a full face
dabbed with an open face to cover. Another tidy over
battered fast and flat through point! That's a vengeful strike, ignoring the calf to gallop to the pitch and crush a cut to the short boundary!
keeps low outside off, from back of a length! Stokes wafts with flat feet. That was awkward

a ferocious slash through the covers! Stokes is on a controlled rampage here, another shimmy down the pitch and a sizzling slap past the close catcher. Close but he'd have worn that rather than caught it
compact this time, anchored in the crease to blot a prod to the off side
back of a length, Stokes pulls from the crease, front leg rising to control the stroke, a gentle steer to midwicket
back of a length, and now Woakes joins the fun! This was less pre-meditated, more a half-tracker outside off. No risk involved, but plenty reward, clean through wide long-on
leaning onto the front foot, looking for the drive, settling for the pat back to the bowler
clipped firmly into the gap at midwicket, meeting the full length to bring up the fifty stand
opens the face, flashed hard through backward point! A good strong hand on the ball from the diving Maxwell prevents it reaching the rope
leg-stump line, back-foot block
flashed hard through point, more intent in the stroke, but tidied up on the edge of the rope

that is too good! It was going to take something outstanding to dislodge Stokes, and Starc serves it up with an impeccable off-stump yorker, tailing back in wickedly as it zeroed in on the base of the pole! He kicks his bat away in disgust, but he's done everything he can to keep England alive ...
inswinging down the leg side, one more to the total
outside off, dabbed down to third man
full face, solid block. Moeen takes a sighter and pushes to mid-off
inside-edged drive past leg stump! He's off the mark, at the very least
whittled off the legs to deep midwicket
rises to meet the lifter into the ribs, nudged behind square
tucked off the legs, Woakes will keep the strike
round the wicket now, shaping into the right hander, on a full length, and punched firmly to cover
flashed hard through point, but there's a man right back on the fence to limit the damage from a well-connected stroke
very full, drawing Moeen forward to meet the swing, and pressed to mid-on
inswinging yorker! Not perfectly directed on this occasion, as Moeen closes the face on a full length
another attempted yorker, Moeen meets it on the full but can't time his crunch into the covers
banged in short, the crowd are miffed that that wasn't a wide. Eleven to go ... something has to give soon!
eased down to long off
width, and a change of pace, that's in Moeen's arc, and he bunts it on the up, over the covers! That will give him some vital confidence

edged and gone! Moeen's shocking run can't end today, a perfect response. Tightened the line and length, nipped off the seam. met the outside edge of a hard-handed push and Carey swallows the catch! Moeen had to look to be assertive, but that ball wasn't there to be attacked, and he was beaten before his stroke could fully take shape
whipped firmly off the legs, the sweeper is set back on the rope
outside off, a rolling drive to deep cover
tapped to the off side, looking to open the face but can't create the angle
slides back, cuts hard to deep cover
Rashid aims in to out, looking to open up the cover boundary, but can't beat the man
there we go! Rashid comes down the wicket, swings feistily through the line and skims out of the reach of the man at long-on
whipped off the pads for the single
a bit of spin, into the arc of an aggressive back-foot swat. The 200 is up ...
Rashid drives but is beaten outside off. Good intent from England, but the execution is a bit lacking still ...
slower ball from round the wicket, drilled up to long-off
outside off, tapped to the off side

a massive wipe over the leg side, but what a catch! Woakes thought he had nailed it, in the arc, a huge heave, but Maxwell tracked back on the edge of the rope, hopped to pouch the ball high above his head, then, cool as you like, lobbed it back to the waiting Finch to complete a routine relay! England, as if you didn't already know it, are sunk without trace in this one!
flipped off the toes, short fine leg is briefly in business, but the ball skims over his head and away to the rope
tucked to the off side
nibbles past a tentative edge
angled into the right-hander, very full, beats a down-on-one-knee drive
sizzling drive, off the back foot, but connects with thin air!
good solid connection on the back foot, but punched straight to the cover sweeper
round the wicket, angled into the pads on the full, an open-faced nurdle to third man
Rashid is so nearly bowled! Staying leg-side, trying to open the off, but misses with a windy back-foot waft as the ball skims the off stump
full length, bending into the stumps, eased out to cover
pounded out to the midwicket sweeper, a moment of excitement for a subdued crowd, until it was clear the boundary was well protected
heave ho! Archer's head ends up pointing at the floodlights as he aims something dirty over the leg side and misses

battered down the throat of long-off! Behrendorff has five wickets, and Australia are one wicket away from the semi-finals! In the slot, but Archer's indifferent batting continues. A new entry for the new-look ODI honours boards
opens the face on a full length, dabbed to point
leg-sided, Rashid rushes through for the single
Behrendorff's stunning spell is done, to a riot of backslaps from his gleeful team-mates. What a win this has been
round the wicket, banged in short, a violent swipe and a top-edge over the keeper! It's something ...
back-to-back boundaries, the patient has a pulse! Rashid has been working on this stroke, an open-faced wristy steer from deep in the crease, through the covers
slower ball, hops over the stumps as Rashid gets in a tangle
opens the face again, and it's all over! A spooned drive to short cover, and Australia have wrapped up a 64-run victory and a place in the World Cup semi-finals!
